extractions.extraction_text: Introduction to Social Network Analysis and Visualization

This session introduces social network analysis (SNA), defining a social network as a social structure of actors (nodes) connected by ties (edges). SNA is the interdisciplinary process of investigating these structures using networks and graph theory to identify patterns and influential entities. Key characteristics of social networks include low average distance between nodes, as exemplified by the 'Six Degrees of Separation' concept. The lecture covers various metrics for analyzing nodes, edges, and the overall network, such as Average Clustering Coefficient, PageRank, and Network Diameter. A significant focus is placed on visualization, particularly force-directed graph drawing algorithms like Fruchterman-Reingold, which arrange graphs aesthetically by simulating physical forces between nodes. The session concludes by outlining hands-on experiments using the 'Game of Thrones' dataset with tools like NetworkX (a Python package) and Gephi (visualization software) to perform network analysis, graph simplification, and visualization.
social network analysis, graph theory, force-directed graph drawing, Fruchterman-Reingold algorithm, NetworkX, Gephi, network metrics, nodes, edges, visualization

attributes.definition: A social structure made up of a set of social actors (such as individuals or organizations), sets of dyadic ties, and other social interactions between actors. It is represented as a graph with nodes (actors) and edges (relationships).
The process of investigating social structures through the use of networks and graph theory to identify local and global patterns, locate influential entities, and examine network dynamics.

A class of algorithms for drawing graphs in an aesthetically-pleasing way by assuming there are physical forces between nodes, with the goal of making the whole system stable or having the lowest energy.
One of the most commonly used force-directed graph drawing algorithms that uses electromagnetism theories to generate a circular graph.
A Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.
An open-source and free visualization and exploration software for all kinds of graphs and networks.

Hello everyone, I am Haiying Che, from Institute of Data Science and knowledge Engineering

in this session we will talk about Social Network analysis
In this session we will learn social network, social network analysis, the Metrics of social networking analysis, and Force-directed graph drawing
At last we will do Social network analysis hands
A social network is a social structure made up of 
a set of social actors (such as individuals or organizations), 
sets of dyadic ties, 
and other social interactions between actors. 
The study of these structures uses social network analysis to identify local and global patterns, locate influential entities, and examine network dynamics.
It characterizes networked structures in terms of nodes (individual actors, people, or things within the network) and the ties, edges, or links (relationships or interactions) that connect them.
Let us watch a video about social network overview
Social network can be presented using a graph. 
A node refers to a social actor, and an edge refers to a relationship. 
The weight of an edge measures how close the relationship is.
Social Network has Low average distance. 
If we draw a social graph of everybody in the world, there will be more than 7 Billion nodes. 
But according to Six Degrees of Separation, the minimum distance of two nodes is very probably less than or equal to 6. 
Thanks to the development of Internet, the average distance of two nodes is going lower.
Social network analysis (SNA) is the process of investigating social structures through the use of networks and graph theory.
Social networks and the analysis of them is an inherently interdisciplinary academic field which emerged from social psychology, sociology, statistics, and graph theory.
Let us watch a video about What is Social Network Analysis 
Some Metrics of social networking analysis,
The metrics about Nodes and edges include Average Clustering Coefficient; Eigenvector Centrality; Average Path Length etc.
The metrics about Network include Average Degree, Average Weighted Degree, Network Diameter, Graph Density, Shortest Path, Hits, Modularity, PageRank, Connected Components and etc.
Visualization is an important way to analyze the social Network. 
Force-directed graph drawing is a good way to visualize the social Network. 
Force-directed graph drawing is an important technology on social network visualization. 
Force-directed graph drawing algorithms are a class of algorithms for drawing graphs in an aesthetically-pleasing way. 
Currently force-directed graph drawing algorithms are Force atlas algorithm, Fruchterman-Reingold algorithm, Yifan Hu algorithm, etc.
The basic theory is assuming that there are forces between nodes and fits in physical models. 
And the goal is to make the whole system stable or has the lowest energy.
Fruchterman-Reingold algorithm is one of the most commonly used algorithms. 
This algorithm uses electromagnetism theories, and generates a circular graph.
Repulsive force  divided by  k ;  Gravitation force 
Final state is to make force balanced
The picture on the left is the Original graph and the picture on the right is Fruchterman-Reingold style, which is more aesthetically-pleasing. 
We will hands on based on the data set of social network of “Game of throne” ,  using NetworkX and Gephi,
NetworkX  is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks. 
Gephi is an open-source and free visualization and exploration software for all kinds of graphs and networks.
Experiment 1 includes Loading data and generate graphs, Network analysis, Visualization using Networkx and Edge bundling using datashader.
Experiment 2 includes Load data and analysis, Graph simplifying using Fruchterman-Reingold algorithm and Visualization and beautification
Experiment 3 includes social network recommendation background setting, biased random walk, node representation learning and recommendation.
all the experiments material including the manual and codes are provided on the platform, which can help you to do the hands-on.
In this session, we learned social network analysis,
